description: Demolition of existing garages and erection of a two storey building comprised of two flats with access, landscaping, cycle storage, refuse and recycling storage.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted ( [Planning Statement], [Design and Access Statement], [Energy and Sustainability Statement], [Preliminary Arboricultural Assessment], [Preliminary Ecological Appraisal], [Daylight and Sunlight Report], [Dusk Emergence Bat Survey], [Preliminary Bat Roost Assessment], [Statement of Community Involvement], [Arboricultural Impact Assessment], [London Development Database Management], [Transport Statement], [Civil Engineering SuDS Report], [200582-1001], [200582-1060], Received: 08/01/2021, [200582-1064], [200582-1065], [200582-1066],  [200582-1303], [200582-1406], Received: 14/02/2022 ) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.
Condition : 3 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the development hereby permitted must be in accordance with the approved plans.

Condition : 4 - Notwithstanding the details shown on the approved plans, prior to first occupation of the hereby approved development, details of secure cycle storage arrangements in accordance with both the London Plan and adopted Local Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The cycle parking shall conform to the West London Cycle Parking Guidance and hard surface paths not less than 1.2 metres wide must be provided to the doors of the cycle stores. The cycle stores shall be made available to occupants upon first occupation of the hereby approved development and maintained as such thereafter without obstruction.

Condition : 5 - Before commencement of works, the developer shall carry out a survey of the condition of the highway and footway within 20 metres of the site to establish any pre-existing damage of the pavement and carriageway and shall submit the same to the Council's highways contractor.
During works, an appropriate wheel-washing system shall be operated to remove mud, stones and other extraneous materials from vehicle wheels and chassis' leaving the site, and all departing loads shall be fully covered to ensure no material is deposited on the highway. The exit from the wheel wash shall be a hard, non-porous surface sited as far away from the exit as is possible given the site constraints and kept clean at all times.  Waste water discharged from the wheel wash shall be stored and disposed of on site and not discharged into the public sewer unless soil, stones and any suspended material have first been removed.
The developer shall ensure that no dust or other debris is carried on to adjoining properties in accordance with the guidance at https://www.london.gov.uk/file/18750/download?token=zV3ZKTpP. 
Site lighting shall be designed, positioned and directed so as not to unnecessarily intrude on passing drivers or direct light into any neighbouring windows in accordance with the guidance provided by the Institute of Lighting Engineers Guidance Note: For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light 2021.
All vehicle arrivals and departures shall be supervised and the condition of the highway examined immediately afterwards.  Any materials shed from the vehicle during such movement shall be immediately removed from the highway, and returned to site or carted away for disposal and shall not be washed into the surface water drainage system.
From the outset of works on site, details shall be prominently displayed at the boundaries of the site, indicating who members of the public can contact and including a phone number available 24 hours a day to obtain resolution of any site-related problems t
Condition : 6 - The hereby approved development must be carried out in accordance with the approved Energy Statement received 08/01/2021, and achieve net 'Zero Carbon' emissions.

Condition : 7 - Upon final commencement of operation of any low and zero carbon technologies, performance data for energy consumption must be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The performance data shall be submitted every 18 months to a monitoring web-platform for a period of three years from the point of full operation.

Condition : 8 - Prior to first occupation of the building(s) evidence (schedule of fittings and manufacturers literature) shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to show that the development has achieved an internal water use of 105 Litres per person per day or less.

Condition : 9 - The developments shall not be occupied until evidence (e.g. photographs and copies of delivery notes, invoices or installation contracts) have been submitted to the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate that the development meets the following:
o	At least three of the key elements of the building envelope (external walls, windows roof, upper floor slabs, internal walls, floor finishes/coverings) are to achieve a rating of A+ to D in the Building Research Establishment (BRE) The Green Guide of specification.
o	At least 50% of timber and timber products are to be sourced from accredited Forest Stewardship Council (FSC) or Programme for the Endorsement of Forestry Certification (PEFC) scheme.
o	No construction or insulation materials are to be used which will release toxins into the internal and external environment, including those that deplete stratospheric ozone.

Condition : 10 - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use, the existing vehicular access to Fir Road shall be permanently closed and the kerbs, verge, and footway reinstated so that it cannot be used as an access across the pavement.

Condition : 11 - Notwithstanding the details on the approved plans, prior to commencement of groundworks (excluding site investigations and demolition), the applicant shall have submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval in writing a final detailed drainage design, including drawings and supporting calculations [and an updated Drainage Assessment Form to be reviewed and approved by the Lead Local Flood Authority. The drainage hierarchy shall make use of green infrastructure technology to comply with the hierarchy set out in London Plan Policy SI3 and the runoff rate shall not exceed 2.5 litres/second.  A detailed management plan confirming routine maintenance tasks for all drainage components shall also be submitted and approved which demonstrates how the drainage system is to be maintained for the lifetime of the development. The development shall be carried out in strict compliance with the approved details.

Condition : 12 - No part of the development hereby approved shall be occupied until evidence (photographs and copies of installation contracts, along with a written confirmation) has been submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to demonstrate that the sustainable drainage scheme hereby approved has been completed in accordance with the submitted final detailed drainage designs. The sustainable drainage scheme shall be managed and maintained thereafter in accordance with the agreed management and maintenance plan for all of the proposed drainage components.

Condition : 13 - The hereby approved development must be carried out in accordance with the approved Landscaping Plan, received: 02/06/2021 and shall be laid out and planted before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use and retained as such thereafter.

Condition : 14 - Before the development hereby permitted commences:
a.	A contaminated land Phase 1 desk study report shall be submitted to, and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Should the Phase 1 report recommend that a Phase 2 site investigation is required, then this shall be carried out and submitted to, and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The site shall be investigated by a competent person to identify the extent and nature of contamination. The report should include a tiered risk assessment of the contamination based on the proposed end use of the site.  Additional investigation may be required where it is deemed necessary.
b.	If required, a scheme for decontamination of the site shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority, for written approval.  The scheme shall account for any comments made by the Local Planning Authority before the development hereby permitted is first occupied.
   During the course of the development:
c.	The Local Planning Authority shall be notified immediately if additional contamination is discovered during the course of the development. A competent person shall assess the additional contamination, and shall submit appropriate amendments to the scheme for decontamination in writing to the Local Planning Authority for approval before any work on that aspect of development continues.  
   Before the development is first brought into use:
d.	The agreed scheme for decontamination referred to in clauses b) and c) above, including amendments, shall be fully implemented and a written validation (closure) report submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval.
